title: Ticket #3194: Code quality issues in volume ID code
description:
Some of our nodes started to abort with the following issue:

08/14/12 13:08:11 ERROR "Failed to get partition id for SLOT1_EXECUTE=/var/lib/condor/execute/sleeper " at line 1047 in file /builddir/build/BUILD/condor-7.9.1/src/condor_startd.V6/ResMgr.cpp

(No other warning message). It appears this is the notification you get for p-slots if the execute directory doesn't exist.

A few issues:

  1. The exception message shouldn't contain a newline.
  2. The Unix version of sysapi_partition_id_raw does not contain any helpful error messages (compare to the Windows version).
  3. The Unix version of sysapi_partition_id_raw contains this gem: snprintf( *result, 50, "%ld", (long)statbuf.st_dev);. By construction, I think this is likely safe. Still scares the heck outta me!

Would be nice to clear this up and get the error message for a missing execute directory to be more user-friendly.
remarks:
2012-Aug-14 13:47:54 by danb:
Indeed. Patch incoming...

2012-Aug-23 11:22:54 by johnkn:
patch looks good to me.
